segment.source: Search or Filter Data
segment.target: Search or Filter Data

segment.source: Search or Filter Data
segment.target: Search or Filter Data

segment.source: Search or Filter Data
segment.target: Search or Filter Data

segment.source: In Windows Performance Analyzer, you can search all the text in data tables.
segment.target: In Windows Performance Analyzer, you can search all the text in data tables.

segment.source: You can also filter data to display only a selection of the data in both the graph and its data table.
segment.target: You can also filter data to display only a selection of the data in both the graph and its data table.

segment.source: To search for text in a data table
segment.target: To search for text in a data table

segment.source: Right-click the table, and then click Find.
segment.target: Right-click the table, and then click Find.

segment.source: Enter the desired text.
segment.target: Enter the desired text.

segment.source: To find the next instance of the text, right-click the table, and then click Find Next.
segment.target: To find the next instance of the text, right-click the table, and then click Find Next.

segment.source: To find the previous instance of the text, right-click the table, and then click Find Previous.
segment.target: To find the previous instance of the text, right-click the table, and then click Find Previous.

segment.source: To filter data in a graph and its data table
segment.target: To filter data in a graph and its data table

segment.source: In the data table, select the desired row or rows.
segment.target: In the data table, select the desired row or rows.

segment.source: Or, in the Legend control to the left of the graph, select the desired item or items.
segment.target: Or, in the Legend control to the left of the graph, select the desired item or items.

segment.source: Right-click the data table, and then click Filter To Selection.
segment.target: Right-click the data table, and then click Filter To Selection.

segment.source: If you want to enable or disable a whole series, right-click the Legend control, and then select the desired option.
segment.target: If you want to enable or disable a whole series, right-click the Legend control, and then select the desired option.

segment.source: To filter out data in a graph and its data table
segment.target: To filter out data in a graph and its data table

segment.source: In the data table, select the desired row or rows.
segment.target: In the data table, select the desired row or rows.

segment.source: Or, in the Legend control to the left of the graph, select the desired item or items.
segment.target: Or, in the Legend control to the left of the graph, select the desired item or items.

segment.source: Right-click the data table, and then click Filter Out Selection.
segment.target: Right-click the data table, and then click Filter Out Selection.

segment.source: If you want to enable or disable a whole series, right-click the Legend control, and then select the desired option.
segment.target: If you want to enable or disable a whole series, right-click the Legend control, and then select the desired option.

segment.source: To undo a filter
segment.target: To undo a filter

segment.source: Right-click the data table, and click Undo Filter.
segment.target: Right-click the data table, and click Undo Filter.

segment.source: To redo a filter
segment.target: To redo a filter

segment.source: Right-click the data table, and click Redo Filter.
segment.target: Right-click the data table, and click Redo Filter.

segment.source: To clear a filter
segment.target: To clear a filter

segment.source: Right-click the data table, and click Clear Filter.
segment.target: Right-click the data table, and click Clear Filter.

segment.source: To choose columns to display in a data table
segment.target: To choose columns to display in a data table

segment.source: In the data table, right-click the title bar.
segment.target: In the data table, right-click the title bar.

segment.source: In the Column Chooser box, select or clear the desired columns individually.
segment.target: In the Column Chooser box, select or clear the desired columns individually.

segment.source: Or, in the Preset drop-down list, select the desired preset combination of columns.
segment.target: Or, in the Preset drop-down list, select the desired preset combination of columns.

segment.source: The data table is immediately updated as you click.
segment.target: The data table is immediately updated as you click.

segment.source: For more information about presets, see Apply, Create, or Delete a Preset Combination of Columns to Display.
segment.target: For more information about presets, see Apply, Create, or Delete a Preset Combination of Columns to Display.
